headline.main: THE ANNUAL REPORT OF THE CITY INSPECTOR.; Frightful Infantile Mortality Swill Milk Worse than Ever, and More Generally used.

docs.lead_paragraph: The annual report of the City Inspector for 1860, prepared for the Common Council, is a very lengthy document, and contains much that is of importance to the public. The returns show that during the year there were 4,241 marriages, 12,454 births, and 22,710 deaths. With the exception of an epidemic which prevailed during the Summer months, in the form of scarlet fever, the City has been unusually healthy.

headline.main: THE ITALIAN QUESTION.; Complications--Negotiations for the Sale of Venetia--Horrible Sacrilege--An American Place of Worship in Florence.

docs.lead_paragraph: FLORENCE, Friday, Dec. 21, 1860. Until a more firmly established state of things succeeds the present turbulent and very precarious political condition of the South of the Peninsula the Italians cannot be at ease, or feel confident that their patriotic work is going on well towards a near and happy end.
